intro: Rhynchospora corymbosa var. singularis, commonly known as the singular spike-rush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to wetland habitats in North America. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes grass-like plants known as sedges. The plant features slender, erect stems that bear dense clusters of small, pale green to brownish flowers. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, typically growing in tight, cylindrical bundles. This variant is distinguished by its singular, elongated inflorescence, which sets it apart from other varieties within the species.
